wikipedia_page.main: Air Commodore Arthur Edmond Clouston,  (7 April 1908 – 1 January 1984) was a British test pilot and senior Royal Air Force officer who took part in several air races and record-breaking flights in the 1930s.

response: | 14–16 November 1937 || G-ACSS || A.E. Clouston and Betty Kirby-Green || London–Cape Town ||  || 45 hr 2min || Named The Burberry.
| 18–20 November 1937 || G-ACSS || A.E. Clouston and Betty Kirby-Green || Cape Town–London ||  || 57 hr 23min || Return trip.
| 15–20 March 1938 || G-ACSS || A.E. Clouston and Victor Ricketts || London–New Zealand ||  || 104 hr 20min || Named Australian Anniversary.
| 20–26 March 1938 || G-ACSS || A.E. Clouston and Victor Ricketts || New Zealand–London ||  || 140 hr 12min || Return leg, completing the first round trip.
